election_record.label: Massachusetts 1816 Maine Separation, May

overview.note: The separation of Maine from Massachusetts was a prominent issue in 1816 and generated a great amount of newspaper articles and commentary. There were two elections in Maine on this question, the first on May 20, 1816 which failed and a second held September 2, 1816, which after some controversy was also declared to have been unsuccessful.

"Separation Of Maine. Yesterday the joint committee on the subject, reported to the Senate, that they found the number of votes in Maine for a separation was 10,584 - the number against it 6,491 - and the whole number of qualified voters in the towns which furnish the returns 37,938." Hampden Federalist (Springfield, MA). June 20, 1816.
The Salem Gazette (Salem, MA) lists 10393 Yea votes, 6501 Nay votes, 36828 Qualified Voters.
The American Advocate lists 10393 Yea votes, 6491 Nay votes, 37938 Qualified Voters.
The Hampton Federalist lists 10398 Yea votes, 6501 Nay votes, 37828 Qualified Voters.
The Hampton Federalist lists 10584 Yea votes, 6491 Nay votes, 37938 Qualified Voters.
The New-Bedford Mercury (New Bedford, MA) lists 10393 Yea votes, 6501 Nay votes, 37828 Qualified Voters.

sub_unit.name: Thompson Pond Plantation
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Thompson Pond Plantation.

sub_unit.name: Hancock
sub_unit.note: Penobscot County was formed April 1, 1816, and The Original Election Returns did not separate Penobscot County from Hancock County, while several of the newspapers did.

The Salem Gazette (Salem, MA), June 11, and the American Advocate and Kennebec Advertiser (Hallowell, ME) and the Washington City Weekly Gazette (Washington, DC), both June 15, list 908 Yea votes and 684 Nay votes in "Hancock and Penobscot" County.

sub_unit.name: Brewer
sub_unit.note: History of Penobscot County, Maine, 572, and the Bangor Weekly Register, May 25, list 36 Yeas for town of Brewer.

sub_unit.name: Buckstown
sub_unit.note: The Bangor Weekly Register, May 25, reports 15 Yea votes in Buckstown.

sub_unit.name: Corinth
sub_unit.note: The Bangor Weekly Register, May 25, reports 34 Yea votes and no Nay votes in Corinth.

sub_unit.name: Eddington
sub_unit.note: The Bangor Weekly Register, May 25, reports 10 Yea votes and 4 Nay votes in Eddington.

sub_unit.name: Frankfort
sub_unit.note: Original Election Returns list no votes for the town of Frankfort. The Bangor Weekly Register May 25, 1816 published the results for several towns, including Frankfort.

sub_unit.name: Garland
sub_unit.note: Original Election Returns list no votes for the town of Garland. The Bangor Weekly Register May 25, 1816 published the results for several towns, including Garland.

sub_unit.name: Hampden
sub_unit.note: History of Penobscot County, Maine, 572, and the Bangor Weekly Register list 43 Yea votes and 32 Nay votes in Hampden.

sub_unit.name: Kennebec
sub_unit.note: On the Original Election Returns for the County of Kennebec, 191 Yea votes were added to the total of 2316. On the Original Election Returns Recapitulation sheet, next to the 191 votes is written the word "mistake".
The Washington City Weekly Gazette (Washington, DC), June 15, reports 667 Nay votes in Kennebec County.

sub_unit.name: Dearborn
sub_unit.note: The American Advocate and Kennebec Advertiser (Hallowell, ME), May 25, reports 18 Yea votes in Dearborn.

sub_unit.name: Lincoln
sub_unit.note: The Columbian Centinel. Massachusetts Federalist (Boston, MA), the Salem Gazette (Salem, MA), the Washington City Weekly Gazette (Washington, DC) and American Advocate and Kennebec Advertiser (Hallowell, ME) list 1772 Nay Votes in Lincoln County.
The Columbian Centinel lists 6952 as the total number of Qualified Voters.

sub_unit.name: Bingham
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Bingham.

sub_unit.name: Washington
sub_unit.note: The Salem Gazette (Salem, MA), June 11, the Columbian Centinel. Massachusetts Federalist (Boston, MA), June 12, and the American Advocate and Kennebec Advertiser (Hallowell, ME) and Washington City Weekly Gazette (Washington, DC), both June 15, list 109 Yea votes, 138 Nay votes, and 670 Qualified to Vote.

sub_unit.name: Lubeck
sub_unit.note: The American Advocate and Kennebec Advertiser (Hallowell, ME) June 1, 1816 lists 48 Yea votes and 11 Nay votes in Lubeck.

sub_unit.name: Machias
sub_unit.note: The Portland Gazette, and Maine Advertiser (Portland, ME) May 28, 1816 lists 36 Yea votes and 46 Nay votes in town of Machias.

sub_unit.name: Wells
sub_unit.note: The Columbian Centinel. Massachusetts Federalist (Boston, MA), June 8, reports 154 Nay votes in Wells.

election_record.reference: Original Election Returns. Massachusetts State Archives, Boston.
American Advocate and Kennebec Advertiser (Hallowell, ME). May 25, 1816.
Portland Gazette, and Maine Advertiser (Portland, ME). May 28, 1816.
American Advocate and Kennebec Advertiser (Hallowell, ME). June 1, 1816.
Columbian Centinel. Massachusetts Federalist (Boston, MA). June 8, 1816.
Columbian Centinel. Massachusetts Federalist (Boston, MA). June 12, 1816.
American Advocate and Kennebec Advertiser (Hallowell, ME). June 15, 1816.
Washington City Weekly Gazette (Washington, DC). June 15, 1816.
American Advocate and Kennebec Advertiser (Hallowell, ME). September 7, 1816.
"The Annals of Bangor", History of Penobscot County Maine. Williams, Chase and, Cleveland: 1882. 572.
